Keywords: Martial Artist , X-Force , X-Men
Real Name: Laura Kinney
Special Powers
HELLFIRE GALA: Once per turn for all characters with this trait, when a friendly character with the X-Men keyword attacks and the attack roll includes exactly one 5, you may replace the other die with a 5.
HIGH FASHION: THIGH-HIGH LEATHER BOOTS AND BLACK LEATHER OPERA GLOVES: When a friendly character with the X-Men keyword hits and a 5-5 was rolled, after resolutions heal that character 2 clicks.
YOU MADE ME RIP MY DRESS!: Blades/Claws/Fangs, but may use it when targeting more than one character, and she must roll a d6 for each hit target. // When Wolverine hits, after resolutions heal her 1 click for each opposing character that took damage from that attack.

December 4, 2022
hoojeebo
12.2b Attack Roll: Effects that allow dice to be rerolled or replaced are used during this step. Reroll effect must be used first, followed by effects that replace die, and then finally apply any effects that otherwise alter the attack roll (such as effects that increase or decrease the result).
December 4, 2022
DOOMBOTSKI
[QUOTE]HELLFIRE GALA:#Once per turn for all characters with this trait, when a friendly character with the X-Men keyword attacks and the attack roll includes exactly one 5, you may replace the other die with a 5. [/QUOTE] My question is, if I rolled a 5 and a 3(whatever) to make my roll two 5s and then my opponent uses PC on my roll, would that be considered as my [B]Once per Turn[/B]? and if I re-rolled a 5 and whatever would that mean I wouldn't be able to invoke Hellfire Gala?
November 27, 2022
gambitrmp
Reminds me of Nick Fury getting psychic blast for armor piecing rounds. Some people will get caught up in the name of the power, others will see it for what it is.
November 20, 2022
Worldbreaker90
[QUOTE=rgstar;12220716]Hypersonic in general for non speedsters can be done well. The way I look at it is that as long as their movement is low enough to make it make sense. 7 Move HSS is a charge with a side step before or after so come in for the swing and then dance back out of reach after.[/QUOTE] I agree 100%. I don't think they are implying that this wolverine actually has "Hypersonic speed" but as you said, it becomes more of a charge with a sidestep. It is only "Hypersonic Speed" as in it uses that mechanic and that is just the name of the reference for that Mechanic.
November 8, 2022
rgstar
Hypersonic in general for non speedsters can be done well. The way I look at it is that as long as their movement is low enough to make it make sense. 7 Move HSS is a charge with a side step before or after so come in for the swing and then dance back out of reach after.
August 11, 2022
Oathful
From a character standpoint, Hypersonic makes no sense on any Wolverine, they could have went with a full-movement charge if they wanted her to close gaps and make more sense as Laura never moves fast enough to be considered Hypersonic tier. As a dial though, this looks nasty, reminds me of garbage can Spider-Man, but with a chance of dealing low damage. Like most of the Gala X-Men, they really sink or swim based on those 5-5 roll traits, which while kind of a weird design I do enjoy. I'll leave my full thoughts on the traits and their dynamics on the Gala Jean Grey, but for this figure I'd probably run her on the lower point value for 300pt games, 100pts is a lot when you could play the previously mentioned Spider-Man for 40pts less to the same effect on a Spider-Man team. Thematic: 5.5/10, Viability: 7/10, Fun Factor: 7/10, fairly balanced figure
August 11, 2022
Slade Wilson
Okay, now we are just being silly. HSS on any Wolverine is just not something we should see. Heck, I can barely tolerate it on a Spider-Man dial. Can we please stop the BS.
